The 'LINK Train' is an automated people mover (APM) service installed by
DCC Doppelmayr Cable Car which connects Terminals 1 and 3 (there is no
Terminal 2) and the Viscount Reduced Rate parking lot and garage at Toronto
Pearson International Airport in Mississauga, Canada. {{cite news
| url = http://dcnonl.com/article/20060705100 title = Airport opens automated

}}  It opened on July 6, 2006, in addition to the LINK bus system which
operated alongside it. The train runs 24 hours a day, 7 days a week and is
wheelchair accessible.
